channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for UT
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for UT

item.title: Report I-2023080058
item.description:
Report I-2023080058

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-02T06:14:17+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-24
  • City: SALT LAKE CITY
  • State: UT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: T FORCE FREIGHT
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: FREIGHT WAS LOADED ONTOP OF THESE DRUMS. FREIGHT RUBBED ACROSS THE TOP AND DAMAGED THE LID. SPILLED DOWN THE SIDE AND LEFT A LITTLE PUDDLE ON THE TOP. DONT LOAD ONTOP OF DRUMS.

item.title: Report E-2023080926
item.description:
Report E-2023080926

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-02T06:14:17+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-17
  • City: WEST VALLEY CITY
  • State: UT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On August 17, 2023, two (2) 1.3-gallon jugs of UN3149 were crushed during transit and released approximately one (1) quart of product to the trailer floor and adjacent boxes. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from EnviroServe (ES) to remediate the impacted site. ES personnel utilized hand tools to collect all freestanding product and other UN3149-impacted materials in one (1) 50-gallon drum and one (1) 30 gallon drum for disposal by R+L.

item.title: Report X-2023080585
item.description:
Report X-2023080585

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-01
  • City: NORTH SALT LAKE
  • State: UT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: LOOSE CAP LEAKING CORROSIVE LIQUID DURING TRANSIT. UNLOADED, PLACED INSIDE A HAZMAT BAG AND RED HAZMAT TOTE. DescribePack: LOOSE CAP LEAKING CORROSIVE LIQUID SOILING THE WET TORN BOX AND ALL CONTENTS INSIDE. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PLACED INSIDE A HAZMAT BAG AND RED HAZMAT TOTE.

item.title: Report X-2023080417
item.description:
Report X-2023080417

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-29T21:11:32+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-03
  • City: SALT LAKE CITY
  • State: UT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A plastic jerrycan was discovered leaking during sort operations at the SLCR facility. The spill agent observed that the cap was loose on the jerrycan. The cap was tightened and it was placed into a steel salvage package. Shipper will be contacted for an amended declaration for movement.
